aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon's Technology and Infrastructure Investment Strategy
Amazon seeks to invest efficiently in numerous areas of technology and infrastructure.
Amazon aims to enhance the customer experience through rapid technology developments.
Amazon aims to improve process efficiency through rapid technology developments.
Amazon operates at an ever increasing scale.
Amazon's technology investment often supports a variety of product and service offerings due to geographic expansion.
Amazon's infrastructure investment often supports a variety of product and service offerings due to geographic expansion.
Amazon's technology investment often supports a variety of product and service offerings due to the cross-functionality of Amazon's systems.
Amazon's infrastructure investment often supports a variety of product and service offerings due to the cross-functionality of Amazon's operations.
Amazon expects spending in technology and infrastructure to increase over time.
Amazon continues to add employees.
Amazon continues to add infrastructure.
Technology costs are allocated to segments based on usage.
Infrastructure costs are allocated to segments based on usage.
The increase in technology costs in 2024 is primarily due to an increase in spending on infrastructure.
The increase in infrastructure costs in 2024 is primarily due to an increase in spending on infrastructure.
The increase in technology costs in 2024 is partially offset by decreased payroll costs.
The increase in infrastructure costs in 2024 is partially offset by decreased payroll costs.
The increase in technology costs in 2024 is partially offset by decreased related costs associated with technical teams.
Technical teams are responsible for expanding Amazon's existing products and services.
Technical teams are responsible for initiatives to introduce new products.
Technical teams are responsible for initiatives to introduce new service offerings.
The increase in technology costs in 2024 is partially offset by a reduction in depreciation expense.
The increase in infrastructure costs in 2024 is partially offset by a reduction in depreciation expense.
The increase in technology costs in 2024 is partially offset by a reduction in amortization expense.
The increase in infrastructure costs in 2024 is partially offset by a reduction in amortization expense.
The reduction in depreciation and amortization expense is from Amazon's change in the estimated useful life of Amazon's servers.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Managementâ€™s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/
/FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Managementâ€™s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/

text: We seek to invest efficiently in numerous areas of technology and infrastructure so we may continue to enhance the customer experience and improve our process efficiency through rapid technology developments, while operating at an ever increasing scale. Our technology and infrastructure investment and capital spending projects often support a variety of product and service offerings due to geographic expansion and the cross-functionality of our systems and operations. We expect spending in technology and infrastructure to increase over time as we continue to add employees and infrastructure. These costs are allocated to segments based on usage. The increase in technology and infrastructure costs in 2024, compared to the prior year, is primarily due to an increase in spending on infrastructure, partially offset by decreased payroll and related costs associated with technical teams responsible for expanding our existing products and services and initiatives to introduce new products and service offerings and a reduction in depreciation and amortization expense from our change in the estimated useful life of our servers.
